Roles: Brute monsters have more hit points and damage, but less defense. They specialize in dealing damage in melee. They don’t hit as often as other monsters, but they deal a lot of damage when they hit. They don’t move around a lot, and they’re often big. Use brutes in an encounter to threaten the PCs while shielding other monsters with their great size and imminent threat.

Assassin monsters have more damage and speed but less hit points. They have some ability that lets them avoid attacks, usually by striking from hiding. They usually deliver one devastating attack every few rounds, while concentrating on defense in between. Use assassins as surprise additions to encounters with other monsters.

Artillery monsters excel at ranged combat but have less defense. These creatures rain arrows, explosive fireballs, and similar attacks on the party from a distance. Use artillery monsters in an encounter to hang behind defenders and brutes and rain damage down on the PCs from protected positions.

Minion monsters deal less damage and destroyed when they take any amount of damage but always appear in numbers. They are designed to serve as shock troops and cannon fodder. Use minions as melee combatants placed between the PCs and back-rank artillery, controller or support monsters.

Controller monsters manipulate their enemies or the battlefield to their advantage. Position controller monsters just behind a front line of melee-focused monsters, and use them to attack the PCs at short range with their control powers. Assign at least one controlling ability for this monster regardless of its trait.

Support monsters bolster or heal their allies and use battlefield to their advantage. Position support monsters just behind a front line of melee-focused monsters or next to artillery, and use them to sustain allies with their powers. Assign at least one supporting ability for this monster regardless of its trait.

Defender monsters have more defense but less damage. They specialize in drawing the PCs attacks and protecting other monsters. Use defenders in an encounter to keep the PCs in place, preventing them from attacking the artillery, controller or support monsters behind the defenders or chasing after the assassins.

Solo monsters have much more hit points and damage. They are specifically designed to appear as single opponents against a group of PCs and function, in effect, as a group of monsters. A solo monster might have tendencies that flavor it toward the brute, defender, assassin, artillery or controller role. Every solo monster has to be able to stand and fight on its own.
Types: An undead is a once-living creature animated by spiritual or supernatural forces. Most undead can see in the darkness; do not require sustenance and sleep; immune to poison and disease; immune to fear and charm effects; resistant to necrotic and cold effects; vulnerable to holy effects. Incorporeal undead may be immune to physical damage unless weapon is silvered, blessed or magical.

A beast is a living, nonhuman vertebrate creature, with no capacity for language or culture. Most beasts have low intelligence and act on instinct. Some beasts can see in the darkness; may have heightened sense of sight, hearing and/or smell. Aerial beasts have flying speed. Aquatic beasts have swimming speed and may breathe underwater. Subterranean beasts have burrowing speed.

An elemental is a creature that composed of one or more natural element and sentient. Most elementals do not require sustenance and sleep; immune to poison and disease; immune to their own element and vulnerable to opposed element (if any). Some elementals may have low intelligence and act on instinct; can see in the darkness.

A plant is a vegetable creature that can perceive and affect the world in some way. Most plants have less speed or stationary; vulnerable to fire and/or cold effects; are mindless and immune to mind-altering effects; do not require sleep. Some plants may rely on other senses than sight, hearing or smell.
Traits: Can attack out of turn multiple times per round.
Instantly switch places with a nearby creature or object.
Forms a defensive barrier out of nearby materials.
When it dies it lets out an ear-piercing howl.
Grows stronger as it loses health.
Gains immunity to the last method of attack used against it.
Able to steal spells from the characters and cast them.
Able to re-write books/maps/letters from a distance.
Flaws: Vulnerable during a specific time of day.
Completely dependent on sight; no other senses.
Completely dependent on smell; no other senses.
It's movements are loud and obvious.
Attacks affect everything nearby, friend or foe.
Cannot see a particular color, or anything painted that color.
Leaves behind a sticky trail that it cannot pass through. Can't backtrack.
Many of the parts can be easily cut off (arms, legs, wings, etc).
Runs away when reduced to low health.
Easily distracted by valuable and shiny things.
Very sick and close to death.
Becomes weaker as it suffers damage.
Vulnerable to a specific race or bloodline.
Must spend time recovering after strong attacks.
Must answer any asked questions with the truth.
Won't attack the same target twice.
Won't harm something that hasn't harmed it.
Vulnerable to a rare metal or alloy.
